comment: I'm usually an A student, and this guy is failing me. Dr. Q (pastor at Trinity Chapel) does not provide feedback until the end of the semester, does not provide rubrics with the assignments, he is stuck on himself, shows up late for classes,expects people to stay hours after classes for appointments, and does not return his emails.

Good teacher and he is entertaining. His teaching style is a little different but it works. He makes me a little nervous because you don't know what to expect from him. You have to study to pass the test but this is college!

Dr Q has vast experience in Social Work and counseling. He loves a lively class therefore encourages all students to participate. He has MANY students who specifically take his courses, which is why faces are familiar to him. Read, attend, participate!! You are guaranteed to learn!! Get a PHd and books published then try not to be proud-Impossible!

Very high energy and very entertaining. He's a great teacher and he wants to engage all of his students, but he's not going to hold your hand. If you're not getting the response you want it may have something to do with the work you're putting in.

I enjoyed his class though they were very intense. He is not the most organized teacher but he is so kind. He will give you the respect that you deserve and is very understanding to each student. He is slightly disorganized. Pretty easy class but he does want to read though I stopped reading after a couple of weeks.
Wonderful teacher, he made the class fun!!

Dr. Nichols' class is very easy. People just don't like to read and put in work. His flaws lie in his untimely grading of assignments as well as lateness to class and his inability to focus and complete one task. Tests can be overwhelming, but if you read, you'll get it.

PROMISED MYSELF TO NEVER TAKE ANOTHER CLASS W/DR. NICHOLS AGAIN... DON'T LIKE THE TEACHING STYLE AND AS YOU MAY KNOW ONLY HIS FAVORITES TEND TO DO WELL THEY TEND TO RECEIVE ALL OF THE ATTENTION AND IF YOU ARE NOT A FAVORITE, THE GRADING TENDS TO BE A BIT HARSHER... THANK GOODNESS I WILL NOT HAVE TO TAKE HIM AGAIN.

Love this professor. He is very charismatic and fun to be in class with. He gives pop quizzes so be sure to read the chapter the night before class. He grades hard, but if you read the chapter you will pass anyway. Know the names of the chapters. It's silly but it's on the quizzes. Overall I would gladly take him again.

I still can't decide whether or not I like him. He definitely has favorites in the class...he takes at least a week to respond to emails. He constantly talks about how he has his doctorate and seems to brag about it. He doesn't really do much teaching, you basically have to teach yourself. Be sure to buy the book.

Dr. Nichols is the worst professor I've had so far.  He spends more time out of the classroom than in it and seems totally uninterested when anyone apart from himself is talking.  He doesn't respond to email AT ALL and never stops patting himself on the back. No feedback given on assignments. No use of Vista. READ THE BOOK cuz he's not teaching!
Very Knowledgeable about the topic. Make sure you read over material before class and you should be fine.
Great Teacher, but make sure you read over material before class and participate.

Great teacher.  You have to participate in class and read the book.  He does have his favorites.  But, if you just join in the class, you will do fine.  Don't mis-take his friendliness for an easy grade.  He is nice to everyone.

I went 2 class ALL CLASSES! and did the work and received an A.  U have to read the book and take notes.  Dr. Nichols makes the learning fun, by sharing, he has been a social worker for years.  U have to go to class and Read if you want to get a good grade. His test are Essay only, so reading the text is a MUST! Spring 2010

Dr.Nichols is an extremely intelligent guy and very friendly. Just show up for class and say a word or two, you get points. You do need to do all of the reading to pass the tests, but this is college so you should be used to that by now. He is a great professor and if you want to truly understand social welfare policies, take his class!

Dr. Nichols is super nice! definitely recommend!  attendance and participation are very important. he gives out his power points. Overall the class is pretty easy except for his tests(mc) and quizzes(fill in the blank pop quizzes). group paper and co facilitation are easy. Nichols really knows his stuff and makes it fun!

Nichols requires work but EVERYTHING is outlined in detail in the syllabus;the work isn't hard. Lets you know what's going to be on the exam a day or two prior.  Gives points for participation AND attendance.  He knows the world of Social Services. Take notes-Read the book! The course REQUIRES you to do 20 hrs of volunteer time. I earned an A!

Dr.Nichols loves himself ...thats for sure. He always has his favorites in the class and makes it very obvious. His lectures are horrible... he reads and highlights notes from a clipboard... and wont post notes. Reading the book is critical to passing any test or "excersize" (what he calls quizzes). I did not enjoy the class at all

Great guy and passionate about Human Services work. He is highly responsive to student's needs and emails. Dr. Nichols' teaching style may not be effective for every student. I need small group projects, writing assignments, application exercises to help me retain information. He mainly lectures and has class discussions and one big group project.
Crisis Intervention: He is stuck on himself and is prejudice
Dr. Nichols was ok and def had his favorites. If he didn't like you in the begiining do everything you can in the class to prove your grade to him. Treated his students differently.
Dr. Nichols is awesome!  Great teacher... lots of fun... will have you rollin'.  He'll make you work for your grade but if you do what you are suppose to you'll have no problem.
